greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) in which n-th row lists the values of the n-th derivative at x=1 of all functions that are representable as x^x^...^x with n x's and parentheses inserted in all possible ways; n>=1, 1<=k<=A000081(n).
comment: The ordering of the functions is the same as in A215703 and is defined by the algorithm below.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..12, flattened
example: For n=4 the A000081(4) = 4 functions and their 4th derivatives at x=1 are x^(x^3)->156, x^(x^x*x)->100, x^(x^(x^2))->80, x^(x^(x^x))->56.
maple: F:= proc(n) F(n):= `if`(n<2, [x$n], map(h->x^h, g(n-1, n-1))) end:
g:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i=1, [x^n],
T:= n-> map(f-> n!*coeff(series(subs(x=x+1, f), x, n+1), x, n), F(n))[]:
xref: Last elements of rows give: A033917.
A version with sorted row elements is: A216350.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 04 2012
